snippet: Los Angeles began taking water from the Owens Valley nearly a century ago, inspiring the movie “Chinatown.” But the fight that ensued may soon be over.
abstract: End to the century-old Owens Valley water wars with Los Angeles appears at hand, with engineers beginning to till 50 square miles of lake bed north of city, instead of flooding it with city water to control dust clouds in valley; Los Angeles is finally accepting responsibility, after years of filing lawsuits against basin saying damage was not city's fault for taking water.
lead_paragraph: Los Angeles began taking water from the Owens Valley nearly a century ago, inspiring the movie “Chinatown.” But the fight that ensued may soon be over.

headline.main: Century Later, the ‘Chinatown’ Water Feud Ebbs
headline.print_headline: Century Later, the ‘Chinatown’ Water Feud Ebbs

keywords.value: Los Angeles Department of Water and Power
